title: How to Make Peanut Butter Fudge

steps.headline: Prepare the baking dish or pan.
steps.description: Line with parchment paper or a silicone sheet.

steps.headline: Put the sugar, evaporated milk and double (heavy) cream into the saucepan.
steps.description: Gently heat. Stir continuously until the sugar dissolves (about 5 minutes).

steps.headline: Turn the heat up to medium.
steps.description: Bring the mixture to the boil, with the candy thermometer in the mixture as it boils, stirring occasionally. Bring to 100ºC/215ºF, then lower the heat to a gentle boil.

steps.headline: Boil for another 10 minutes on low heat.
steps.description: When the mixture reaches 115ºC/240ºF, it is ready to remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Whisk the mixture.
steps.description: You can use a wooden spoon to do this or make it easier by using a handheld electric whisk or food processor. Beat for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the peanut butter.
steps.description: Beat for another 15 minutes or until the mixture ceases to appear shiny.

steps.headline: Let cool slightly.
steps.description: About an hour after cooling, score the square marks on the surface of the fudge.

steps.headline: Let cool completely.
steps.description: Once completely cooled and set, either cut or break the fudge into squares. The fudge is now ready to serve or give as a gift. For a gift, line a box or other container with wax paper to prevent sticking and leakage of the fat from the fudge. Store in an airtight container.

steps.description: Gently heat the ingredients until the sugar dissolves (about 5 minutes). Stir continuously while cooking.

methods.name: Making Chocolate and Peanut butter Fudge

steps.headline: Prepare the baking dish or pan.
steps.description: Line with parchment paper or a silicone sheet.

steps.headline: Put the cream cheese into the bowl.
steps.description: Sift the icing/confectioners sugar and cocoa into the bowl. Add the smooth peanut butter. Mix all ingredients together well.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate and butter.
steps.description: Place into the double boiler to melt over gentle heat. Add a tablespoon of the cream cheese mixture. Stir occasionally until melted. Remove the melted mixture from the heat.

steps.headline: Pour the melted mixture into the cream cheese mixture.
steps.description: Whisk or beat together thoroughly, until well combined and smooth. A handheld electric beater will make this process easier. Once it appears creamy, it's ready for pouring.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the prepared pan or dish.
steps.description: Use a spatula or spoon to push it right out to the corners of the pan or dish. Smooth over with the back of the spoon or spatula.

steps.headline: Cover with a tea towel or lid and let sit in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
steps.description: The fudge will firm up. Don't let the towel touch the fudge; it should only rest on the pan/dish edges.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Run a butter knife around the edges of the fudge. Tip the whole piece of fudge onto a cutting board and peel off the paper or silicone mat, if needed.

steps.headline: Cut into even sized squares.
steps.description: Place back in the fridge for another 2 hours to harden completely. It is now ready to serve or give as a gift. This fudge must be kept stored in the refrigerator, in an airtight container.

text: Making Crunchy Peanut Butter Fudge Prepare the baking dish or pan. Line with parchment paper or a silicone sheet. Put the sugar, evaporated milk and double (heavy) cream into the saucepan. Gently heat. Stir continuously until the sugar dissolves (about 5 minutes). Turn the heat up to medium. Bring the mixture to the boil, with the candy thermometer in the mixture as it boils, stirring occasionally. Bring to 100ºC/215ºF, then lower the heat to a gentle boil. Boil for another 10 minutes on low heat. When the mixture reaches 115ºC/240ºF, it is ready to remove from the heat. Whisk the mixture. You can use a wooden spoon to do this or make it easier by using a handheld electric whisk or food processor. Beat for 10 minutes. Pour in the peanut butter. Beat for another 15 minutes or until the mixture ceases to appear shiny. Let cool slightly. About an hour after cooling, score the square marks on the surface of the fudge. Let cool completely. Once completely cooled and set, either cut or break the fudge into squares. The fudge is now ready to serve or give as a gift. For a gift, line a box or other container with wax paper to prevent sticking and leakage of the fat from the fudge. Store in an airtight container. Making Salty Peanut Butter Fudge Line the baking dish or pan with parchment paper. Or, use a silicone sheet. Put the sugar, milk and peanut butter into the saucepan. Gently heat the ingredients until the sugar dissolves (about 5 minutes). Stir continuously while cooking. Bring the mixture to the boil. Using a candy thermometer, check for the optimal temperature of 115ºC/240ºF. Stir occasionally. Remove the fudge mixture from the heat. Add the chopped salted peanuts and stir through. Continue stirring until the whole mixture thickens. Pour the fudge mixture into the prepared dish or pan. Let cool slightly. As the fudge starts setting, use a butter knife to score square marks on the top of the fudge. Let cool completely. Cut the squares of fudge when the fudge is totally set. The fudge is now ready to serve or give as a gift. For a gift, line a box or other container with wax paper to prevent sticking and leakage of the fat from the fudge. Store in an airtight container. Making Chocolate and Peanut butter Fudge Prepare the baking dish or pan. Line with parchment paper or a silicone sheet. Put the cream cheese into the bowl. Sift the icing/confectioners sugar and cocoa into the bowl. Add the smooth peanut butter. Mix all ingredients together well. Melt the chocolate and butter. Place into the double boiler to melt over gentle heat. Add a tablespoon of the cream cheese mixture. Stir occasionally until melted. Remove the melted mixture from the heat. Pour the melted mixture into the cream cheese mixture. Whisk or beat together thoroughly, until well combined and smooth. A handheld electric beater will make this process easier. Once it appears creamy, it's ready for pouring. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan or dish. Use a spatula or spoon to push it right out to the corners of the pan or dish. Smooth over with the back of the spoon or spatula. Cover with a tea towel or lid and let sit in the refrigerator for 2 hours. The fudge will firm up. Don't let the towel touch the fudge; it should only rest on the pan/dish edges. Remove from the refrigerator. Run a butter knife around the edges of the fudge. Tip the whole piece of fudge onto a cutting board and peel off the paper or silicone mat, if needed. Cut into even sized squares. Place back in the fridge for another 2 hours to harden completely. It is now ready to serve or give as a gift. This fudge must be kept stored in the refrigerator, in an airtight container.
